title: Maria Thorisdottir strikes for Chelsea to end Arsenal's unbeaten WSL start
text:
Chelsea 2 Arsenal 1

This London derby was a chance for Chelsea to get back at last year’s champions Arsenal, and it was one they relished with an emphatic 2-1 win at Kingsmeadow. From Chelsea’s dogged pressing up front it was clear they were still stinging from being denied Champions League football after a third-place finish in the WSL last season and losing 5-0 to the Gunners at home.

“If you get it right you’re an unbelievable manager, if you don’t you’re a pile of s----. I got it right today”, said Chelsea manager Emma Hayes. “You can lose a season at the beginning of the year but you don’t necessarily win it. So I can say that we are not out of the title race, which this time last year we were, that’s the difference.”

Yet again it was Chelsea that were to be Arsenal’s undoing, a late winner from Maria Thorisdottir securing the win for the home side in a tense finish in front of a record crowd for a league game at Kingsmeadow. The Blues were one of only two teams to defeat Arsenal in the WSL last season and they did it again here, ending Arsenal’s run of 11 consecutive WSL wins.
description: This London derby was a chance for Chelsea to get back at last year’s champions Arsenal, and it was one they relished with an emphatic 2-1 win at Kingsmeadow.
